required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Trigger Point Massage in Chronic Tension Headache
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy of Trigger Points Massage in Severity of Chronic Tension Headache:An Unmasked, Randomized, Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock:
Patients with IHS criteria of chronic tension headache , considering inclusion and exclusion criteria, enrolled to this study. They will be randomized to intervention or control group by block randomization method, then treat by standard drug( nortriptyline 10 mg daily) or trigger point massage.
They report severity, frequency, duration of headaches and number of analgesic drugs in diary during week 1 and week 4. Then data based on dairy will be analysis.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Mean Visual Analogue Scale sore change in week 4 from the baseline
primary_outcome.description: By Visual Analogue Scale score,from 0 that indicate no pain to 10 that indicate severe pain

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change in number of attacks in week 4 from the base line
Change in Time duration in week 4 from the baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Time duration ( in minutes)of attacks in week

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change in Number of analgesic drugs used in week 4 from the baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Number of analgesic drugs used during a week

intervention.description: Massage the trigger points in 8 different points for 1 min in circle direction and 3 times a day.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Chronic tension type headache according to IHS criteria
2. Finding painful trigger point in physical examination
3. no contraindication for massage
4. no prophylactic treatment
5. written inform consent
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Dementia or severe cognitive impairment
2. Under Treatment with drugs with prophylactic effect
3. History of RA or Cervicocephalic fracture or other skeletal deformity
4. Other complementary treatment
